TopicTitle: Building a Space Swing on the Mun!

Articles.Content:
Hi everyone,

after lurking through this forums for month I finally registered here so... hi everyone:D

I had a new idea in my head after visiting those arches on mun... why not build a swing there?

This is what I have in mind:

At least for one of them it looks like fun

On top is a claw that I planned to attach on one of the arches at mun.

So now the tricky part, you (or better I) can't lift that whole thing into orbit, the swing seat will ("surprise") swing all the way wobbling and distracting the rocket until you'll explode.

So how to get it up? and after that, brake it and get it down in one piece?

My next idea was to build some rovers who then dock some girder parts together on mun. But then you'll have the whole swing lying on the ground and I doubt you'll get it up without the same problem of wobbling.

So... any ideas how to give our kerbals their mun theme park?

Lock it in place with struts and girders that can be detached via decouplers once it's delivered? That's what I do when I'm launching my one piece spacestation/lander combos (a single docking port wasn't giving a strong enough connection).

Love the idea, BTW. I wonder if a single EVA jetpack would be enough to get it swinging on the Mun...

Can you get it to do a 360?

Edited July 11, 2014 by Wanderfound
Turn it so the chain hangs down and attach a pair of launchers to the rigid metal frame.

Can you do the full circle

Claw's can't attach to the terrain of a moon/planet. At least, not in my experience.

What a great idea! I hope to see a Mun arch swing someday soon.

If you don't mind using a mod, UbioZur's Welded Parts was meant for just this situation. You can use it to weld most of the swing into one rigid part, then add the claw, seats, and thrusters to that. It's nice for rovers too; rigidizing (is that a word?) the frame helps eliminate suspension problems.

Make a hook from girders and hang it over the top of the arch?

Two hooks, one each side of the peak of the arch. Possibly with station-keeping thrusters built in for fine tuning.

What else do we need? Merry-go-round? Slippery dip? Rover dodgem cars? Roller coaster?

I had a new idea in my head after visiting those arches on mun... why not build a swing there?

This is KSP, we need to think BIGGER. Forget the stupid arms, put the center of mass of the swing in synchronous orbit, make it long enough to come within a good leap of the surface, then you can hop on at the bottom of the swing, and hop off in high retrograde orbit. I don't think it's possible on the Mun or Minmus, but Eeloo has a synchronous orbit around 680km up. Surely we can make a truss 1,360km long and get it out there...
